de.mrapp.android.validation

Class AbstractValidateableView<ViewType extends android.view.View,ValueType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.LinearLayout
          • de.mrapp.android.validation.AbstractValidateableView<ViewType,ValueType>
  • Type Parameters:
    ViewType - The type of the view, whose value should be able to be validated
    ValueType - The type of the values, which should be validated
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent, Validateable<ValueType>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EditText, Spinner

    public abstract class AbstractValidateableView<ViewType extends android.view.View,ValueType>
extends android.widget.LinearLayout
implements Validateable<ValueType>
    An abstract base class for all views, whose value should be able to be validated according to the pattern, which is suggested by the Material Design guidelines.
    Since:
    1.0.0

      A data structure, which allows to save the internal state of an AbstractValidateableView.

      Adds a new validator, which should be used to validate the view's value.
      protected abstract android.view.ViewGroup createParentView()
      The method, which is invoked in order to create the parent view of the view, whose value should be able to be validated.
      protected abstract ViewType createView()
      The method, which is invoked in order to create the view, whose value should be able to be validated.
      java.lang.CharSequence getError()
      Returns the error message, which has been previously set to be displayed.
      int getErrorColor()
      Returns the color, which is used to indicate validation errors.
      java.lang.CharSequence getHelperText()
      Returns the helper text, which is shown, when no validation error is currently shown.
      int getHelperTextColor()
      Returns the color of the helper text.
      java.util.Collection<Validator<ValueType>> getValidators()
      Returns a collection, which contains all validators, which are used to validate the view's value.
      protected abstract ValueType getValue()
      The method, which is invoked in order to retrieve the current value of the view.
      protected ViewType getView()
      Returns the view, whose value should be able to be validated.
      boolean isValidatedOnFocusLost()
      Returns, whether the value of the view is automatically validated, when the view loses its focus, or not.
      boolean isValidatedOnValueChange()
      Returns, whether the value of the view is automatically validated, when its value has been changed, or not.
      protected java.util.Collection<Validator<ValueType>> onGetLeftErrorMessage()
      The method, which is invoked in order to validate the current value of the view and to retrieve the error message, which should be shown at the left edge of the view, if a validation fails.
      protected java.util.Collection<Validator<ValueType>> onGetRightErrorMessage()
      The method, which is invoked in order to validate the current value of the view and to retrieve the error message, which should be shown at the right edge of the view, if a validation fails.

      protected android.os.Parcelable onSaveInstanceState() 
      protected void onValidate(boolean valid)

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractValidateableView

        public AbstractValidateableView(android.content.Context context)
        Creates a new view, which allows to enter text.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the view, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null

      • AbstractValidateableView

        public AbstractValidateableView(android.content.Context context,
                                android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet)
        Creates a new view, whose value should be able to be validated according to the pattern, which is suggested by the Material Design guidelines.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the view, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the view, as an instance of the type AttributeSet or null, if no attributes are available

      • AbstractValidateableView

        public AbstractValidateableView(android.content.Context context,
                                android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet,
                                int defaultStyle)
        Creates a new view, whose value should be able to be validated according to the pattern, which is suggested by the Material Design guidelines.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the view, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the view, as an instance of the type AttributeSet or null, if no attributes are available
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this preference. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource

      • AbstractValidateableView

        public AbstractValidateableView(android.content.Context context,
                                android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet,
                                int defaultStyle,
                                int defaultStyleResource)
        Creates a new view, whose value should be able to be validated according to the pattern, which is suggested by the Material Design guidelines.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the view, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the view, as an instance of the type AttributeSet or null, if no attributes are available
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this preference. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource
        defaultStyleResource - A resource identifier of a style resource that supplies default values for the preference, used only if the default style is 0 or can not be found in the theme. Can be 0 to not look for defaults
